headline: The Home Depot Names Angie Brown EVP and Chief Information Officer
summary: The Home Depot®, the world's largest home improvement retailer, today announced that Angie Brown has been named executive vice president (EVP) and chief information officer (CIO). As CIO, Brown will be responsible for all aspects of the company's technology strategy, infrastructure, cybersecurity and software development for The Home Depot's 2,350 retail stores and more than 790 branches, its supply chain facilities, store support centers and online systems.

headline: HD Q1 Earnings Call: Revenue Rises, Margin Declines Amid Cautious Consumer Spending
summary: Home improvement retail giant Home Depot (NYSE:HD) fell short of the market’s revenue expectations in Q1 CY2025, but sales rose 9.4% year on year to $39.86 billion. Its non-GAAP EPS of $3.56 per share was 0.8% below analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: 1 Stock That Turned $1,000 Into $32 Million
summary: Investors will be in awe when learning that this company has produced a monster 3,157,000% total return in the past 44 years.  A strategy of expanding the store footprint over the decades has resulted in a massive industry-leading retailer.  Over the very long term, the S&P 500 (SNPINDEX: ^GSPC) has produced an annualized return of about 10%, a figure that includes dividends.
